verses.kjv: And the LORD visited Sarah as he had said, and the LORD did unto Sarah as he had spoken.
verses.ct: The LORD came to Sarah just as he had promised, and the LORD fulfilled his word to Sarah.

verses.kjv: For Sarah conceived, and bare Abraham a son in his old age, at the set time of which God had spoken to him.
verses.ct: Sarah became pregnant and gave Abraham a son in his old age, at the exact time God had told him.

verses.kjv: And Abraham called the name of his son that was born unto him, whom Sarah bare to him, Isaac.
verses.ct: Abraham named the son that Sarah bore to him Isaac.

verses.kjv: And Abraham circumcised his son Isaac being eight days old, as God had commanded him.
verses.ct: When Isaac was eight days old, Abraham circumcised him, just as God had commanded.

verses.kjv: And Abraham was an hundred years old, when his son Isaac was born unto him.
verses.ct: Abraham was a hundred years old when his son Isaac was born.

verses.kjv: And Sarah said, God hath made me to laugh, so that all that hear will laugh with me.
verses.ct: Sarah said, "God has made me laugh, and everyone who hears about this will laugh along with me."

verses.kjv: And she said, Who would have said unto Abraham, that Sarah should have given children suck? for I have born him a son in his old age.
verses.ct: She also said, "Who would have told Abraham that Sarah would nurse children? Yet I have given him a son in his old age."

verses.kjv: And the child grew, and was weaned: and Abraham made a great feast the same day that Isaac was weaned.
verses.ct: The child grew, and on the day Isaac was weaned, Abraham held a great feast.

verses.kjv: And Sarah saw the son of Hagar the Egyptian, which she had born unto Abraham, mocking.
verses.ct: Sarah noticed that the son Hagar the Egyptian had borne to Abraham was mocking.

verses.kjv: Wherefore she said unto Abraham, Cast out this bondwoman and her son: for the son of this bondwoman shall not be heir with my son, even with Isaac.
verses.ct: So she told Abraham, "Send this slave woman and her son away, because the son of this slave woman will not share the inheritance with my son Isaac."

verses.kjv: And the thing was very grievous in Abraham’s sight because of his son.
verses.ct: This deeply troubled Abraham because it concerned his son.

verses.kjv: And God said unto Abraham, Let it not be grievous in thy sight because of the lad, and because of thy bondwoman; in all that Sarah hath said unto thee, hearken unto her voice; for in Isaac shall thy seed be called.
verses.ct: But God told Abraham, "Do not be troubled over the boy or your slave woman. Listen to everything Sarah tells you, because your descendants will be traced through Isaac."

verses.kjv: And also of the son of the bondwoman will I make a nation, because he is thy seed.
verses.ct: "I will also make the slave woman's son into a nation, because he is your offspring."

verses.kjv: And Abraham rose up early in the morning, and took bread, and a bottle of water, and gave it unto Hagar, putting it on her shoulder, and the child, and sent her away: and she departed, and wandered in the wilderness of Beersheba.
verses.ct: Abraham got up early the next morning, took some bread and a container of water, and placed them on Hagar's shoulder. He gave her the child and sent her on her way. She left and roamed through the wilderness of Beersheba.

verses.kjv: And the water was spent in the bottle, and she cast the child under one of the shrubs.
verses.ct: When the water in the container ran out, she placed the child beneath one of the bushes.

verses.kjv: And she went, and sat her down over against him a good way off, as it were a bow shot: for she said, Let me not see the death of the child. And she sat over against him, and lift up her voice, and wept.
verses.ct: Then she walked away and sat down at a distance, about as far as an arrow flies, because she said, "I cannot watch the child die." Sitting there across from him, she began to cry aloud.

verses.kjv: And God heard the voice of the lad; and the angel of God called to Hagar out of heaven, and said unto her, What aileth thee, Hagar? fear not; for God hath heard the voice of the lad where he is.
verses.ct: God heard the boy's voice, and the angel of God called out to Hagar from heaven, saying, "What is wrong, Hagar? Do not be afraid, for God has heard the boy's voice right where he is."

verses.kjv: Arise, lift up the lad, and hold him in thine hand; for I will make him a great nation.
verses.ct: "Get up, pick up the boy, and take him by the hand, for I will make him into a great nation."

verses.kjv: And God opened her eyes, and she saw a well of water; and she went, and filled the bottle with water, and gave the lad drink.
verses.ct: Then God opened her eyes, and she saw a well of water. She went over, filled the container with water, and gave the boy a drink.

verses.kjv: And God was with the lad; and he grew, and dwelt in the wilderness, and became an archer.
verses.ct: God was with the boy as he grew up. He lived in the wilderness and became a skilled archer.

verses.kjv: And he dwelt in the wilderness of Paran: and his mother took him a wife out of the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: He settled in the wilderness of Paran, and his mother chose a wife for him from the land of Egypt.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass at that time, that Abimelech and Phichol the chief captain of his host spake unto Abraham, saying, God is with thee in all that thou doest:
verses.ct: Around that time, Abimelech and Phichol, the commander of his army, spoke to Abraham, saying, "God is with you in everything you do."

verses.kjv: Now therefore swear unto me here by God that thou wilt not deal falsely with me, nor with my son, nor with my son’s son: but according to the kindness that I have done unto thee, thou shalt do unto me, and to the land wherein thou hast sojourned.
verses.ct: "So now, swear to me here before God that you will not deal dishonestly with me, my children, or my descendants. Show me and the land where you have been living the same kindness I have shown you."

verses.kjv: And Abraham said, I will swear.
verses.ct: Abraham replied, "I swear it."

verses.kjv: And Abraham reproved Abimelech because of a well of water, which Abimelech’s servants had violently taken away.
verses.ct: Abraham then confronted Abimelech about a well of water that Abimelech's servants had seized by force.

verses.kjv: And Abimelech said, I wot not who hath done this thing: neither didst thou tell me, neither yet heard I of it, but to day.
verses.ct: Abimelech answered, "I have no idea who did this. You never mentioned it to me, and I only heard about it today."

verses.kjv: And Abraham took sheep and oxen, and gave them unto Abimelech; and both of them made a covenant.
verses.ct: Abraham brought sheep and cattle and gave them to Abimelech, and the two of them made a covenant.

verses.kjv: And Abraham set seven ewe lambs of the flock by themselves.
verses.ct: Abraham separated seven ewe lambs from the flock and set them apart.

verses.kjv: And Abimelech said unto Abraham, What mean these seven ewe lambs which thou hast set by themselves?
verses.ct: Abimelech asked Abraham, "What is the purpose of these seven ewe lambs you have set apart?"

verses.kjv: And he said, For these seven ewe lambs shalt thou take of my hand, that they may be a witness unto me, that I have digged this well.
verses.ct: Abraham answered, "Accept these seven ewe lambs from me so that they will serve as proof that I dug this well."

verses.kjv: Wherefore he called that place Beersheba; because there they sware both of them.
verses.ct: That is why the place was named Beersheba, because the two of them swore an oath there.

verses.kjv: Thus they made a covenant at Beersheba: then Abimelech rose up, and Phichol the chief captain of his host, and they returned into the land of the Philistines.
verses.ct: After they made a covenant at Beersheba, Abimelech and Phichol, the commander of his army, departed and returned to the land of the Philistines.

verses.kjv: And Abraham planted a grove in Beersheba, and called there on the name of the LORD, the everlasting God.
verses.ct: Abraham planted a tamarisk tree in Beersheba and worshiped the LORD there, the everlasting God.

verses.kjv: And Abraham sojourned in the Philistines’ land many days.
verses.ct: Abraham lived in the land of the Philistines for a long time.
